TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BuildItemGroup extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.IEnumerable

remarks.format:
## Remarks A BuildItemGroup object can represent an element in the project, or a virtual collection of items, containing the items created after evaluating wildcards in the `Include` and `Exclude` attributes of an `Item` element.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project> object and uses the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project.LoadXml%2A> method to add content to the project. The <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem>, BuildItemGroup, and <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroupCollection> classes are used to add, remove, and change items in the project.
[!code-vb[msbuild_AddNewItem#1](../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/AddNewItem/Module1.vb#1)] [!code-cs[msbuild_AddNewItem#1](../add/codesnippet/CSharp/AddNewItem/Program.cs#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup"> class.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem AddNewItem (string itemName, string itemInclude);
.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem AddNewItem(string itemName, string itemInclude) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem.Name%2A> property value to assign the new <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem>.
The <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem.Include%2A> property value to assign the new <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem>.
Docs.summary: Adds a new <see cref="T:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem"> with the specified <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem.Name%2A> and <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem.Include%2A> property values to the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup>.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project> object and uses the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project.LoadXml%2A> method to add content to the project. The <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem>, <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup>, and <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroupCollection> classes are used to add, remove, and change items in the project.
[!code-vb[msbuild_AddNewItem#1](../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/AddNewItem/Module1.vb#1)] [!code-cs[msbuild_AddNewItem#1](../add/codesnippet/CSharp/AddNewItem/Program.cs#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem AddNewItem (string itemName, string itemInclude, bool treatItemIncludeAsLiteral);
.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem AddNewItem(string itemName, string itemInclude, bool treatItemIncludeAsLiteral) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem.Name%2A> property value to assign the new <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem>.
The <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem.Include%2A> property value to assign the new <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem>.
`true` to treat the parameter as a literal value; otherwise, `false`.
Docs.summary: Adds a new <see cref="T:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem"> with the specified <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem.Name%2A> and <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem.Include%2A> property values to the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup>, allowing you to specify whether the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem.Include%2A> property value is treated as a literal.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup.Condition%2A> property value and all <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem> objects from the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup Clone(bool deepClone) cil managed

Docs.param: `true` to create a deep copy of the <see cref="T:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup">; otherwise, `false`.
Docs.summary: Creates a deep or shallow copy of the <see cref="T:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup">.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A shallow copy of a <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup> references the same property group as the original. Modifications a shallow copy will be reflected in both copies.
A deep copy of a <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup> creates a new XML element to reference so that both copies of the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup> can be independently modified.
If the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup> corresponds directly to a element in the project (rather than corresponding to a collection of items created after evaluating wildcards in the `Include` and `Exclude` attributes of an `Item` element), only deep copies are allowed.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the `Condition` attribute value of the item group.
Docs.value: The `Condition` attribute value of the item group.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating the number of <see cref="T:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem"> objects in the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup>.
Docs.value: An integer value representing the number of <see cref="T:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem"> objects in the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets an enumerator that iterates through the <see cref="T:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup">.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method allows the caller to use the `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](../add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]) to iterate through the individual <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem> objects in the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup>.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project> object and uses the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem>, <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildProperty><xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup>, and <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildPropertyGroup> classes to list all the items and properties in the project.
[!code-vb[msbuild_ListItemsAndProperties#1](../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/ListItemAndPropertiesVB/Module1.vb#1)] [!code-cs[msbuild_ListItemsAndProperties#1](../add/codesnippet/CSharp/ListItemAndPropertiesCS/Program.cs#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the item group was imported into the project.
Docs.value: `true` if the item group was imported into the project; otherwise, `false`.

Docs.param: The zero-based index of the <see cref="T:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem"> object to get or set.
Docs.summary: Gets or sets a <see cref="T:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem"> object in this <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup>.

Docs.param: The zero-based index of the <see cref="T:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem"> object to remove.
Docs.summary: Removes the <see cref="T:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem"> at the specified index from the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem[] ToArray() cil managed

Docs.summary: Copies the <see cref="T:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem"> objects in the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup> to a new array.
Docs.returns: A new array containing the <see cref="T:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem"> objects copied from the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup>.
